circumstances: Daniel Cooper, age 10, was last seen at an amusement park he visited with friends and his foster father. The group had planned a day of fun, with their first stop being the roller coaster. However, when it was time to leave, Daniel was nowhere to be found. His foster father, who had been at the college earlier that day, coordinated with park staff and contacted the authorities, initiating a thorough search. Inquiries revealed that Daniel had spoken to Mohammad Davidson, a family friend, moments before vanishing, but no signs of distress were noted. Meanwhile, Rebecca Williams and Sheila Elliott, his friends, helped by searching the area and distributing flyers. Ultimately, Daniel was traced two days later, safe at Burntisland Road, Kinghorn.

circumstances: Daniel Cooper, a 14-year-old foster child from Bangor, was reported missing from his residence at 3 South Feus, Upper Largo. Concerns grew when Daniel failed to return home from school and missed a scheduled meeting with Anna Bryant, a colleague from the local community center known to mentor Daniel. Attempts to contact him via mobile were unsuccessful, raising his absence to a medium risk level. During the investigation, police gathered insights from Mohammad Davidson, who mentioned Danielâ€™s recent interest in exploring new areas. Four days into the search, Daniel was located by the police at an acquaintance's house on Fairykirk Road, Rosyth. Daniel was found safe and in good health, having intentionally visited the area for a brief escape without informing his guardians.
